2.summary:
This document outlines the preventive health services covered under the MEC/Preventative Health Services plan. Benefits are automatically subject to 29 CFR § 2590.715-2713(a), with amendments incorporated through legislative acts or regulations. The preventive services include medical services rated 'A' or 'B' by the United States Preventive Services Task Force, preventive care for infants, children, and adolescents as per HRSA guidelines, and immunizations recommended by the Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices of the CDC.

The plan covers various screenings and preventive medications. Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm Screening is available once per lifetime for men aged 65-75 who have smoked. Adult Annual Standard Physicals are covered once per plan year for adults. Alcohol misuse screenings and counseling are provided annually for adults 18 and older, including pregnant women. Aspirin is prescribed for adults aged 50-59 at risk of cardiovascular diseases. Bacteriuria Screening is available once per plan year for pregnant women. BRCA Risk Assessment and Genetic Counseling/Testing are covered annually for women with a family history of certain cancers. Breast Cancer Preventive Medications are prescribed for women at increased risk. Breast Cancer Screening is available once every two years for women aged 50 and older, limited to 2D mammograms.

It is important to note that none of these preventive health services are covered if provided at a hospital.

1.summary:
The Reliant Care 3 plan offers a structured set of benefits focusing on primary care, specialist visits, hospitalization, telemedicine, and prescription services. Members are entitled to four primary care office visits per year with a co-pay of $25 and a maximum charge of $150 per visit. Specialist or urgent care visits are also limited to four per year, with a $50 co-pay and a $300 maximum per visit. In-patient hospitalization benefits provide $1,000 per day, capped at $15,000 annually, with a 12-month pre-existing condition exclusion period.

Telemedicine services are available with no consult fee and no maximum usage limit, enhancing accessibility to healthcare professionals. The prescription plan covers preventive and acute prescriptions, subject to a formulary. Generic drugs are available at no co-pay for a 30-day supply, while preferred generics incur a $5 co-pay. Non-preferred generics and brand drugs require member payment, with specific co-pays for retail and mail-order options.

The plan includes a 30-day waiting period for sickness benefits and requires the use of in-network providers for outpatient services. Hospitalization benefits are not payable for pre-existing conditions within the first 12 months. The plan does not cover specialty drugs and has specific terms for prescription benefits, including a $150 monthly limit for non-preventive maintenance prescriptions. Members must adhere to guidelines for prescription assistance programs and mail-order options.

3.summary:
This document provides a detailed summary of the preventative health services covered under the MEC plan, focusing on the intervals and specific requirements for each benefit. The plan includes breastfeeding support, supplies, and counseling, which are provided in conjunction with each birth. Interventions during pregnancy and after birth are covered, including costs for renting breastfeeding equipment.

Cervical cancer screening with cytology is available once every three plan years for women aged 21 to 65. For those aged 30 to 65 with high-risk HPV, screening is available once every five years. Chlamydia screening is offered annually for sexually active women aged 24 and younger, as well as older women at increased risk.

Colorectal cancer screening is provided once every five plan years for adults aged 50 to 75, with benefits for a colonoscopy if initial screening is positive. Contraceptive methods and counseling are covered as prescribed, including FDA-approved methods and patient education.

Dental caries prevention for infants and children up to age 5 is available annually, with fluoride varnish application and oral fluoride supplementation starting at age 6 months. Depression screening is offered annually for the general adult population, including pregnant and postpartum women, with a focus on accurate diagnosis and follow-up.

Diabetes screening is available annually for adults aged 40 to 70 who are overweight or obese, with counseling interventions for those with abnormal blood glucose. Fall prevention for older adults is provided annually for those aged 65 and older at risk for falls. Folic acid supplementation is covered as prescribed for women planning pregnancy. Gestational diabetes mellitus screening is available for asymptomatic pregnant women after 24 weeks of gestation.

5.summary:
This document outlines the preventative health services covered under the MEC plan, detailing various screenings and counseling services available to plan members. Each benefit is listed with its interval and specific requirements, ensuring clarity on eligibility and coverage. Preeclampsia screening is available once per plan year for pregnant women, focusing on blood pressure measurements throughout pregnancy. Rh incompatibility screening is provided during the first pregnancy visit and again at 24-28 weeks' gestation for unsensitized Rh (D)-negative women, unless the biological father is known to be Rh (D)-negative.

Sexually transmitted infections counseling is offered once per plan year for sexually active adolescents and adults at increased risk. Skin cancer behavioral counseling is available for young individuals aged 6 months to 24 years with fair skin types, emphasizing ultraviolet radiation exposure minimization. Statin preventive medication is prescribed for adults without a history of cardiovascular disease but with certain risk factors, including age and calculated risk scores.

Syphilis screening is provided annually for non-pregnant persons at increased risk and all pregnant women. Tobacco use counseling and interventions are covered twice per plan year, with specific provisions for pregnant women and school-aged children. Tuberculosis screening is available annually for at-risk populations. Vision screening is offered once every two plan years for children aged 3 to 5 years. Well-woman visits and well-child visits are covered annually, focusing on age-appropriate preventive services and prenatal care.

6.summary:
This document provides a detailed summary of benefits related to MEC/Preventative Health Services, focusing on immunizations recommended by the Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. The immunizations are categorized by age groups, specifically from birth through six years old and from seven through eighteen years old. 

For children from birth through six years old, the document lists vaccines such as Hepatitis B, Diphtheria, Tetanus, and Acellular Pertussis (DTap), Haemophilus Influenzae Type B (Hib), Pneumococcal 13-valent Conjugate (PCV13), Inactivated Poliovirus (IPV), Influenza (yearly), Measles, Mumps, and Rubella (MMR), Varicella, Hepatitis A, and Rotavirus. Each vaccine is associated with specific age requirements and limitations, such as the age range for administration and any specific conditions for the doses.

For children from seven through eighteen years old, the document includes vaccines like Influenza (yearly), Tetanus, Diphtheria, and Acellular Pertussis (Tdap), Human Papillomavirus (HPV), and Meningococcal Serogroups A, C, W, Y (MenACWY). The document specifies the age range for each vaccine and any additional notes, such as the need for a 3-shot series of the HPV vaccine for those with weakened immune systems.

The document emphasizes the importance of adhering to the recommended age requirements and limitations for each vaccine to ensure effective immunization.

4.summary:
This document outlines the preventative health services covered under the MEC plan, focusing on various screenings and counseling services. The benefits include Gonorrhea Prophylactic Medication, which is provided as prescribed for all newborns to prevent gonococcal ophthalmia neonatorum. Gonorrhea Screening is available once per plan year for sexually active women aged 24 years or younger and older women at increased risk. Healthy Diet and Physical Activity Counseling is offered once per plan year for adults who are overweight or obese with cardiovascular disease risk factors, aiming to promote a healthful diet and physical activity.

Hemoglobinopathies Screening is available once per plan year for sickle cell disease in newborns. Hepatitis B and C screenings are provided once per plan year for pregnant women at their first prenatal visit and for adults at high risk, respectively. High Blood Pressure Screening is available once per plan year for adults aged 18 or older. HIV Preexposure Prophylaxis is prescribed for individuals at high risk of HIV infection, while HIV Screening is available once per plan year for adolescents and adults aged 15 to 65 years, including pregnant women.

Additional screenings include Hypothyroidism Screening for newborns, Intimate Partner Violence Screening for women of reproductive age, and Lung Cancer Screening for adults aged 55 to 80 years with a significant smoking history. Obesity Screening and Counseling are provided for children and adolescents aged 6 years and older, with referrals for intensive behavioral interventions. Osteoporosis Screening is available for women aged 65 and older, and Phenylketonuria Screening is conducted for newborns.

8.summary:
The document outlines the exclusions and limitations associated with the MEC/Preventative Health Services plan. It specifies that claims arising from service outside the United States are not covered, except for reasonable costs billed by the Veterans Administration or Department of Defense. Claims for services not medically necessary or those exceeding customary rates are excluded. Public health program reimbursements are not covered, regardless of participant election.

The plan excludes claims due to acts of war, terrorism, and certain medical procedures like abortion services unless specified in the schedule of benefits. Custodial care, investigatory treatments, and services not approved under clinical trials are also excluded. Claims related to self-inflicted injuries, illegal acts, and domestic violence are not covered. The plan does not cover treatments for weight control, infertility, or cosmetic surgery unless specified.

Additional exclusions include claims for disability from sterilization reversal, personal convenience items, and non-emergency care outside the U.S. Routine care for adults and newborns, alternative medicine, and certain therapies are not covered. The document emphasizes that the exclusions are meant to clarify non-covered treatments and should not imply coverage under the plan.

7.summary:
This document provides a detailed summary of benefits related to MEC/Preventative Health Services, focusing on immunizations for adults aged nineteen years or older. The immunizations covered include Influenza (IIV, RIV, LAIV), Tetanus, Diphtheria, and Acellular Pertussis (Tdap), Measles, Mumps, and Rubella (MMR), Varicella (VAR), Zoster (RZV, ZVL), Human Papillomavirus (HPV-Female, HPV-Male), Pneumococcal (PCV13, PPSV23). Each vaccine has specific age requirements and limitations, such as annual doses or specific age ranges for administration. For example, the Influenza inactivated vaccine is recommended annually for ages 19 to 65, while the Tdap vaccine requires a booster every ten years for the same age group.

The document also outlines exclusions applicable to the benefits offered under this plan. These exclusions include office visits, physical examinations, and tests for various non-medical purposes such as sports, employment, and legal proceedings. Additionally, any medical service, treatment, or procedure not covered under this plan, including cosmetic surgery unless medically necessary, is excluded. Other exclusions cover treatments related to teeth or periodontium, and any claims related to employment or worker's compensation policies. The exclusions section provides a comprehensive list of scenarios and conditions that are not covered, ensuring clarity on the limitations of the plan.

22.summary:
The Reliant Care 4 plan offers a range of healthcare services with specific coverage limits and co-pay structures. Physician services are provided through the First Health Network, with wellness exams covered for one visit per year at a $25 co-pay, capped at $150 per visit. Primary care office visits are allowed four times per year with a $50 co-pay, also capped at $150 per visit. Specialist or urgent care visits are similarly limited to four per year, with a $75 co-pay and a $300 maximum per visit.

In-patient hospitalization benefits are set at $1,000 per day, with a yearly maximum of $10,000, subject to a 12-month pre-existing condition exclusion. In/outpatient surgery is covered up to $1,000 per year, with a $2,000 annual maximum, also subject to the same pre-existing condition clause. Emergency room visits, if admitted, incur a $1,000 per incident charge, and ambulance services are covered at $500 per incident, both with the 12-month pre-existing condition limitation.

Telemedicine services are available with no consult fee and no maximum limit. Pharmacy benefits include a 30-day supply of acute and preventive generic prescriptions, with member payments required for non-preferred generics and brand drugs. Preferred generics have a $5 co-pay, while brand drugs require prior authorization and have specific co-pay amounts for retail and mail orders. The plan includes a hospital bill reducer and is subject to a 30-day waiting period for sickness benefits. Coverage is limited to in-network providers, and certain specialty drugs are not covered. The plan does not cover services unless listed in the Schedule of Benefits, and all benefits are subject to specific terms, conditions, and limitations.

31.summary:

Benefits are automatically subject to specific federal regulations, and any amendments through legislative acts are incorporated by reference. The preventive services include medical services rated 'A' or 'B' by the United States Preventive Services Task Force, preventive care for infants, children, and adolescents, and immunizations recommended by the Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices.

The plan covers a variety of screenings and preventive medications. Abdominal aortic aneurysm screening is available once per lifetime for men aged 65-75 who have smoked. Alcohol misuse screening and counseling are available once per plan year for adults 18 and older, including pregnant women. BRCA risk assessment and genetic counseling/testing are covered once per plan year for women with a family history of certain cancers. 27.summary:

For children from birth through six years old, the document lists vaccines such as Hepatitis B, Diphtheria, Tetanus, and Acellular Pertussis (DTap), Haemophilus Influenzae Type B (Hib), Pneumococcal 13-valent Conjugate (PCV13), Inactivated Poliovirus (IPV), Influenza, Measles, Mumps, and Rubella (MMR), Varicella, Hepatitis A, and Rotavirus. Each vaccine is associated with specific age requirements and limitations, such as the age range for administration and any special conditions, like the recommended age for the Rotavirus vaccine being between two months and six months.

For children from seven through eighteen years old, the document outlines vaccines including Influenza, Tetanus, Diphtheria, and Acellular Pertussis (Tdap), Human Papillomavirus (HPV), and Meningococcal Serogroups A, C, W, Y (MenACWY). The HPV vaccine, for instance, is recommended for ages eleven to twelve, with a note that a three-shot series is needed for those with weakened immune systems or those starting the series at fifteen years or older. The MenACWY booster is recommended at age sixteen.

The document emphasizes the importance of adhering to these age-specific guidelines to ensure optimal health outcomes and compliance with public health recommendations.

30.summary:

In-patient hospitalization benefits provide $1,000 per day, capped at $10,000 annually, with a 12-month pre-existing condition exclusion period.

Telemedicine services are available with no consult fee and no maximum limit, enhancing accessibility to healthcare professionals remotely. The prescription plan includes preventative and acute prescriptions, subject to a formulary but not a monthly maximum. Pharmacy retail options allow for up to a 30-day supply, with members paying for the medication and a $0 copay for generic drugs. Mail-order options extend to a 90-day supply for 200 generic maintenance drugs, with a $5 copay for preferred generics.

The plan includes several limitations and exclusions. All sickness benefits are subject to a 30-day waiting period before becoming payable. Outpatient services are restricted to in-network providers, while inpatient benefits are not payable for pre-existing conditions within the first 12 months. The plan does not cover services outside the listed benefits, emphasizing the importance of reviewing the Schedule of Benefits for detailed coverage information.

49.summary:
This document outlines the preventative health services covered under the MEC plan, focusing on various screenings and counseling services. The benefits include Gonorrhea Prophylactic Medication, which is provided as prescribed for newborns to prevent gonococcal ophthalmia neonatorum. Gonorrhea Screening is available once per plan year for sexually active women aged 24 years or younger and older women at increased risk. Healthy Diet and Physical Activity Counseling is offered once per plan year for adults who are overweight or obese with cardiovascular disease risk factors, aiming to promote a healthful diet and physical activity. Hemoglobinopathies Screening is provided once per plan year for sickle cell disease in newborns. Hepatitis B and C screenings are available once per plan year for pregnant women and adults at high risk, respectively.

High Blood Pressure Screening is conducted once per plan year for adults aged 18 or older. HIV Preexposure Prophylaxis is prescribed for individuals at high risk of HIV infection, while HIV Screening is available once per plan year for adolescents and adults aged 15 to 65 years, including pregnant women. Hypothyroidism Screening is conducted for newborns once per plan year. Intimate Partner Violence Screening is available once per plan year for women of reproductive age. Lung Cancer Screening is offered once per plan year for adults aged 55 to 80 years with a significant smoking history. Obesity Screening and Counseling are provided once per plan year for children and adolescents aged 6 years and older, as well as adults with a BMI of 30 kg/m2 or higher. Osteoporosis Screening is available once per plan year for women aged 65 and older. Phenylketonuria Screening is conducted for newborns once per plan year.

53.summary:
The document outlines the exclusions and limitations associated with the MEC/Preventative Health Services plan. It specifies that claims arising from service outside the United States are not covered, except for reasonable costs billed by the Veterans Administration or Department of Defense. Claims for services not deemed medically necessary or those exceeding customary rates are excluded. Public health program reimbursements are not covered, regardless of participant election.

The plan excludes claims related to acts of war, terrorism, and certain medical procedures such as abortion services unless specified in the schedule of benefits. Custodial care, investigatory treatments, and services not approved under clinical trials are also excluded. Claims due to self-inflicted injuries, illegal acts, or domestic violence are not covered unless resulting from a medical condition. The plan does not cover claims related to weight control, infertility, or cosmetic surgery unless specified.

Additional exclusions include claims for disability from sterilization reversal, personal convenience items, and non-emergency care outside the U.S. Routine care for adults and newborns, alternative medicine, and certain therapies are not covered. The document emphasizes that the exclusions are meant to clarify non-covered treatments and should not imply coverage under the plan.

52.summary:
This document provides a detailed summary of benefits related to immunizations for adults aged nineteen years or older under the MEC/Preventative Health Services plan. The immunizations covered include Influenza inactivated, Influenza recombinant, Influenza live attenuated, Tetanus, diphtheria, and acellular pertussis, Measles, mumps, and rubella, Varicella, Zoster recombinant, Zoster live, Human papillomavirus for both females and males, Pneumococcal 13-valent conjugate, and Pneumococcal 23-valent polysaccharide. Each vaccine has specific age requirements and limitations, such as the number of doses and age ranges for administration. For example, the Influenza inactivated vaccine is administered annually for ages 19 to 65, while the Tetanus, diphtheria, and acellular pertussis vaccine is given to ages 19 to 65 with a booster every 10 years.

The document also outlines exclusions applicable to the benefits offered under this plan. These exclusions include office visits, physical examinations, immunizations, and tests when required solely for activities such as sports, camp, employment, travel, and other non-medical purposes. Additionally, any medical service, treatment, or procedure not covered under this plan, as well as any other expenses, bills, charges, and monetary obligations, are excluded unless explicitly provided by the plan. Specific exclusions also cover cosmetic surgery unless medically necessary, treatment related to teeth or periodontium, and any claims related to employment or worker's compensation policies.

51.summary:
This document provides a detailed summary of benefits related to MEC/Preventative Health Services, focusing on immunizations recommended by the Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. The immunizations are intended for routine use in children, adolescents, or adults. The document is divided into two main sections based on age groups: Birth Through Six Years Old and Children From Seven Through Eighteen Years Old.

For the age group Birth Through Six Years Old, the document lists several vaccines along with their abbreviations and specific age requirements. These include Hepatitis B (HepB) for ages 4 weeks to 2 months and 6 months to 18 months, Diphtheria, tetanus, and acellular pertussis (DTap) for ages 15 months to 18 months, and Haemophilus influenzae type b (Hib) for ages 12 months to 15 months. Other vaccines include Pneumococcal 13-valent conjugate (PCV13), Inactivated poliovirus (IPV), Influenza (yearly), Measles, mumps, and rubella (MMR), Varicella (VAR), Hepatitis A (HepA), and Rotavirus (RV), each with specific age requirements and limitations.

For the age group Children From Seven Through Eighteen Years Old, the document specifies vaccines such as Influenza (yearly) for ages 7 to 18 years, Tetanus, diphtheria, and acellular pertussis (Tdap) for ages 11 to 12 years, and Human papillomavirus (HPV) for ages 11 to 12 years with additional notes for those with weakened immune systems. Meningococcal serogroups A,C,W,Y (MenACWY) is recommended for ages 11 to 12 years, with a booster at age 16. The document outlines specific age requirements and limitations for each vaccine, ensuring clarity on the recommended immunization schedule.

presentation.content:
### Presentation Plan for Reliant Care Insurance Plans

#### Cover (1 slide)
- **Title:** Reliant Care
- **Tagline:** "Empowering Your Health Journey with Tailored Insurance Solutions"

#### Plan Overview (1 slide)
- **Target Audience:** Individuals and families seeking flexible healthcare solutions.
- **Offerings:** A range of plans focusing on preventive care, wellness, and varying levels of medical coverage.
- **Key Benefits:** Accessibility to healthcare services, affordability, and personalized plan options to suit diverse needs.

#### Core Plan Elements (2-3 slides)
- **Coverage Areas:** 
  - Physician services, hospitalization, telemedicine, and prescription coverage.
- **Plan Structure:** 
  - Tiered options with varying co-pays, visit limits, and annual maximums.
- **Eligibility:** 
  - Designed for individuals and families, with a focus on affordability and accessibility.

#### Common Service Features (2-3 slides)
- **Provider Networks:** 
  - Utilizes the First Health Network for in-network services.
- **Claims Management:** 
  - Efficient claims processing with support tools.
- **Support Tools:** 
  - Wellness programs, advocacy services, and telemedicine access.

#### Plan Tiers Breakdown (8-12 slides)
- **Reliant Care Wellness:**
  - Focus on preventive care and wellness benefits.
  - Includes one wellness exam per year with a $25 co-pay.
  - Telemedicine services with no consult fee.

- **Reliant Care 1:**
  - Three primary care visits per year, $25 co-pay, $150 max per visit.
  - One specialist visit per year, $50 co-pay, $300 max per visit.
  - Hospitalization: $1,000/day, $5,000 annual max, 12-month pre-existing exclusion.
  - Telemedicine with no consult fee.

- **Reliant Care 2:**
  - Four primary care visits per year, $25 co-pay, $150 max per visit.
  - Two specialist visits per year, $50 co-pay, $300 max per visit.
  - Hospitalization: $1,000/day, $10,000 annual max, 12-month pre-existing exclusion.
  - Telemedicine with no consult fee.

- **Reliant Care 3:**
  - Four primary care visits per year, $25 co-pay, $150 max per visit.
  - Four specialist visits per year, $50 co-pay, $300 max per visit.
  - Hospitalization: $1,000/day, $15,000 annual max, 12-month pre-existing exclusion.
  - Telemedicine with no consult fee.

- **Reliant Care 4:**
  - Four primary care visits per year, $50 co-pay, $150 max per visit.
  - Four specialist visits per year, $75 co-pay, $300 max per visit.
  - Hospitalization: $1,000/day, $10,000 annual max, 12-month pre-existing exclusion.
  - Telemedicine with no consult fee.

- **Reliant Care 5:**
  - Five primary care visits per year, $50 co-pay, $150 max per visit.
  - Five specialist visits per year, $75 co-pay, $300 max per visit.
  - Hospitalization: $1,500/day, $15,000 annual max, 12-month pre-existing exclusion.
  - Telemedicine with no consult fee.

#### Comparison Slides (Markdown Table)
```markdown
| Plan Tier       | Primary Care Visits | Specialist Visits | Hospitalization Benefit | Telemedicine | Co-pay Structure |
|-----------------|---------------------|-------------------|-------------------------|--------------|------------------|
| Wellness        | 1 per year          | N/A               | N/A                     | No fee       | $25 per visit    |
| Reliant Care 1  | 3 per year          | 1 per year        | $1,000/day, $5,000 max  | No fee       | $25/$50 per visit|
| Reliant Care 2  | 4 per year          | 2 per year        | $1,000/day, $10,000 max | No fee       | $25/$50 per visit|
| Reliant Care 3  | 4 per year          | 4 per year        | $1,000/day, $15,000 max | No fee       | $25/$50 per visit|
| Reliant Care 4  | 4 per year          | 4 per year        | $1,000/day, $10,000 max | No fee       | $50/$75 per visit|
| Reliant Care 5  | 5 per year          | 5 per year        | $1,500/day, $15,000 max | No fee       | $50/$75 per visit|
```

#### Limitations and Exclusions (1-2 slides)
- **Exclusions:** 
  - Pre-existing conditions for hospitalization (12-month exclusion).
  - Specialty drugs not covered.
  - Services not listed in the Schedule of Benefits.
- **Limitations:** 
  - 30-day waiting period for sickness benefits.
  - In-network provider requirements for outpatient services.

#### Key Takeaways and Action Steps (1 slide)
- **Flexibility:** 
  - Multiple plan options to suit different needs and budgets.
- **Balance:** 
  - Cost-effective solutions with essential coverage.
- **Next Steps:** 
  - Review plan details, consult with a representative, and enroll in the plan that best fits your needs.

#### Thank You (1 slide)
- **Message:** 
  - "Thank you for considering Reliant Care. We are committed to supporting your health journey with tailored insurance solutions."

script.content:
---- Cover ----

Hello, everyone! Thank you for joining today's session on the Reliant Care Health Insurance Plans. We'll walk through the features and benefits of these plans, designed to support your health and financial well-being. Let's get started!

---- Reliant Care Overview ----

The Reliant Care plans offer a range of coverage options.

They provide preventive care to help you manage your health proactively.

Telemedicine services and support tools are included for your convenience.

Prescription coverage is available through a formulary system.

Advocacy services are also part of the package to support your healthcare journey.

---- Key Features and Benefits ----

Let's explore the key features and benefits of these plans.

Primary care visits are included to ensure you have access to essential healthcare.

Specialist visits are covered, allowing you to consult with experts when needed.

Hospitalization benefits are part of the plan to support you during hospital stays.

Telemedicine services vary by plan, offering flexibility in how you access care.

Prescription assistance is available through BestChoice RX, providing support for your medication needs.

---- Cost Management Tools ----

Now, let's discuss the cost management tools available with this plan.

The Hospital Bill Reducer, or HBR, is designed to help manage hospital expenses.

Advocacy services are in place to assist you with navigating healthcare costs.

Prescription assistance support is also available to help manage medication expenses.

---- How Hospital Bill Reducer Works ----

Here's how the Hospital Bill Reducer works.

First, you enroll through Reliant Care.

Next, submit your hospital bills for review.

The charges are then reviewed and negotiated.

You will receive an adjusted bill through the HBR system.

Pay the reduced amount and save on healthcare costs.

---- Preventive Care and Wellness ----

Let's look at the preventive care and wellness services.

Annual physicals are included to help you maintain your health.

Screening programs are available for early detection of potential health issues.

Kindly Human provides telemedicine services to support your wellness journey.

---- Telehealth Services ----

Now, let's discuss the telehealth services offered.

There is no consult fee, making it easy to access care.

You have unlimited access to telehealth services.

Remote consultations are available for your convenience.

You can access care twenty-four hours a day, seven days a week.

---- Advocacy and Support Services ----

Let's explore the advocacy and support services.

These services offer broad healthcare advocacy to assist you.

Bill negotiation assistance is available to help manage costs.

Prescription assistance options are provided to support your medication needs.

Telemedicine support services are also included for comprehensive care.

---- Reliant Care 1 (One of Two) ----

Let's examine our first plan tier, Reliant Care 1.

Primary care visits include three visits per year with a twenty-five dollar co-pay and a one hundred fifty dollar maximum per visit.

Specialist visits are covered for one visit per year with a fifty dollar co-pay.

Hospitalization benefits provide one thousand dollars per day with a five thousand dollar annual maximum.

---- Reliant Care 1 (Two of Two) ----

Continuing with Reliant Care 1.

Telemedicine services are available with no consult fee and unlimited access.

Advocacy services include the hospital bill reducer to help manage costs.

---- Reliant Care 2 (One of Two) ----

Now, let's look at our second plan tier, Reliant Care 2.

Primary care visits include four visits per year with a twenty-five dollar co-pay and a one hundred fifty dollar maximum per visit.

Specialist visits are covered for two visits per year with a fifty dollar co-pay.

Hospitalization benefits provide one thousand dollars per day with a ten thousand dollar annual maximum.

---- Reliant Care 2 (Two of Two) ----

Continuing with Reliant Care 2.

Telemedicine services are available with no consult fee and unlimited access.

Prescription coverage includes preventive and acute medications.

---- Reliant Care 3 (One of Two) ----

Let's move on to Reliant Care 3.

Primary care visits include four visits per year with a twenty-five dollar co-pay and a one hundred fifty dollar maximum per visit.

Specialist visits are covered for four visits per year with a fifty dollar co-pay.

Hospitalization benefits provide one thousand dollars per day with a fifteen thousand dollar annual maximum.

---- Reliant Care 3 (Two of Two) ----

Continuing with Reliant Care 3.

Telemedicine services are available with no consult fee and unlimited access.

Prescription coverage includes preventive and acute medications.

---- Reliant Care 4 (One of Two) ----

Now, let's explore Reliant Care 4.

Primary care visits include four visits per year with a fifty dollar co-pay and a one hundred fifty dollar maximum per visit.

Specialist visits are covered for four visits per year with a seventy-five dollar co-pay.

Hospitalization benefits provide one thousand dollars per day with a ten thousand dollar annual maximum.

---- Reliant Care 4 (Two of Two) ----

Continuing with Reliant Care 4.

Telemedicine services are available with no consult fee and unlimited access.

Prescription coverage includes preventive and acute medications.

---- Reliant Care 5 (One of Two) ----

Finally, let's look at Reliant Care 5.

Primary care visits include five visits per year with a fifty dollar co-pay and a one hundred fifty dollar maximum per visit.

Specialist visits are covered for five visits per year with a seventy-five dollar co-pay.

Hospitalization benefits provide one thousand five hundred dollars per day with a fifteen thousand dollar annual maximum.

---- Reliant Care 5 (Two of Two) ----

Continuing with Reliant Care 5.

Telemedicine services are available with no consult fee and unlimited access.

Prescription coverage includes preventive and acute medications.

---- Comparing Plan Tiers ----

Let's compare the different tiers available.

Reliant Care 1 offers three primary care visits per year, while Reliant Care 5 offers five.

Specialist visits range from one per year in Reliant Care 1 to five in Reliant Care 5.

Hospitalization benefits vary, with a maximum of five thousand dollars in Reliant Care 1 and fifteen thousand dollars in Reliant Care 5.

All plans offer unlimited telemedicine access.

Prescription coverage ranges from discounts to formulary options.

---- Definitions and Limitations ----

Let's review important definitions and limitations.

Pre-existing conditions have a twelve-month exclusion and apply to hospitalization.

Outpatient services are covered in-network only.

Prescription limits are set at one hundred fifty dollars monthly.

Specialty drugs are not covered under these plans.

---- Key Takeaways and Reminders ----

Here are the key points to remember.

These plans offer broad coverage benefits.

Preventive services are included to support your health.

Telemedicine access provides convenient care options.

In-network providers are required for coverage.

---- Closing ----

Thank you for your time today. We hope this information helps you make informed decisions about your health coverage. Continue to be great!

| **Feature** | **Reliant Care 1** | **Reliant Care 2** | **Reliant Care 3** | **Reliant Care 4** | **Reliant Care 5** |
|---------|----------|----------|-----------|-----------|-----------|
| Primary Care Visits | 3/year | 4/year | 4/year | 4/year | 5/year |
| Specialist Visits | 1/year | 2/year | 4/year | 4/year | 5/year |
| Hospitalization | $5,000 max | $10,000 max | $15,000 max | $10,000 max | $15,000 max |
| Telemedicine | Unlimited | Unlimited | Unlimited | Unlimited | Unlimited |
| Prescription Coverage | Discount | Formulary | Formulary | Formulary | Formulary |

script.content:
Let's compare the different tiers available.

Reliant Care 1 offers three primary care visits per year, while Reliant Care 5 offers five.

Specialist visits range from one per year in Reliant Care 1 to five in Reliant Care 5.

Hospitalization benefits vary, with a maximum of five thousand dollars in Reliant Care 1 and fifteen thousand dollars in Reliant Care 5.

All plans offer unlimited telemedicine access.

Prescription coverage ranges from discounts to formulary options.
